wikipedia_page.main: Gwilym Iwan Jones (3 May 1904 – 25 January 1995) was a Welsh photographer and anthropologist.  His photographs of life in Nigeria in the 1930s, taken whilst serving as a colonial District Officer, led to an interest in ethnology and a second career as an academic at the University of Cambridge.
